info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 4 at 7:31PM PDT until June 4 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Alpine.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 731 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grover Hot Springs and Markleeville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
Recent burn areas are more prone to flooding, debris flows, and rock falls. Plugged culverts, rocks and debris on roads, and water and mud over roads are common during moderate to heavy rains. Increased sediment and debris can lead to impacts in areas typically not prone to flooding. Use extra caution when traveling in or below recent burn areas. Impactful flooding and debris flows may be generated by 15 minutes or less of heavy rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING
